alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 07 at 3:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: .Widespread heavy rain is forecast to move into the Susitna Valley that has the potential to cause flooding across the area. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Copper River Basin. This includes the cities of Glennallen, Eureka, Mccarthy, Paxson, And Slana. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks and flooding may occur in areas of poor drainage and across low roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain will begin early Thursday morning and extend through Friday morning, with storm totals through Saturday expected of up to 2 to 4 inches in Chitina and north of the Denali Highway. Expect up to 4 to 6 inches in the higher elevations near McCarthy. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
